title: Yeah, Resolve tree SUCKS
body:
im jungle main, 

i usually play Rengar but occasionally I'll play a tank like Zac or Mundo. 

Resolve tree is a joke; even on tanks, precision / inspiration / sorcery  all feel better than shit fucking resolve tree. Oh yea i have to wait for 10 minutes to get resists while {{champion:64}} etc. fulls clears and comes out at full HP 100% HP ready to gank.

you're just encouraging everyone to play pure damage champs at this point; and i mean that directed at jungle role. Anything tank related (besides the obviously overpowered {{champion:113}} {{champion:57}} ) is complete shit because of clear speed and lack of early game defenses while everyone else has quite high damage. Even bruisers like {{champion:254}} {{champion:62}} fare far better on an assassin build that includes {{item:3134}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} 

I'll still pretty much only play rengar, but I don't think i'll ever be tempted to play a tank jungle given the shit masteries you offer them.

replies.body: There's a lot of exploration going on to make the resolve tree feel like it's got a lot more contextual/interesting choices that you can make. It can be pretty tricky balancing defensive runes lest they become "must haves" on everyone, but there's some pretty fun stuff we're playing around with atm. Currently they definitely don't feel particularly exciting when compared to runes in the other trees - we're on it!
Who came up with Demolish? And did any of you ever consider making Demolish Ohmwrecker's active?

yea thanks but it's not about defensive runes feeling good.

it's about making defensive runes for TANKS useful without letting squishies abuse them.

that's basically what you have to do. Balance them in a way that they benefit champs that want to build health & defenses without letting ADCs and mages and assassins abuse runes that would make them tankier than they would supposed to be.
Just a heads up, you replied to the wrong comment so the rioter didn't get a notification from it.
Already asked and answered months ago, yes they did. IIRC the reasoning was that they didn't want to replace one niche effect with another so it fit better as a rune.

Why not separate tanks (resolve tree) and tinker more on another tree for bruisers? I already  know whatever you put in the resolve tree to make bruisers better, will just make tanks even more better...
fun fact do you know bruiser is a class too?
Are there any plans on bringing back SOTA?
Overgrowth.
kappa that doesnt even come close to sota.
Not sure what you're doing wrong, then, because I'm hitting 300+ health at 25 minutes on a support budget.
"support" not a jungle, try hitting 200 hp with jungle !
The hero we deserve.
for more than 2 months you cant give us a bruiser keystone 2MONTHS. can you imagine someone constantly bullying your child for 2 months? you can handle that? maybe you can but not me

why does font of life even exist in the resolve tree

mirror shell/iron skin are pretty lame too

just replace these with useful runes

maybe make conditioning the gathering storm counterpart 

there choice available

Out of the 16 keystones, there's only 4 that you can proc without hitting an enemy champion and NONE in the Resolve Tree.

This is what makes it shitty.
Guardian.

You need a teammate:

Guardian - Guard allies you cast spells on and those that are very nearby. If you or a guarded ally would take damage, you're both hasted and granted a shield.

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a8r2Eeey,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-01-19T02:33:17.325+0000)
>
> There's a lot of exploration going on to make the resolve tree feel like it's got a lot more contextual/interesting choices that you can make. It can be pretty tricky balancing defensive runes lest they become "must haves" on everyone, but there's some pretty fun stuff we're playing around with atm. Currently they definitely don't feel particularly exciting when compared to runes in the other trees - we're on it!

you probably need to either add a whole new tree focused around tanks and crowd control and make the resolve tree for adding basic resistances and maybe a little healing or to add more defensive options to the other rune categories so resolve isn't a go-to for non-tanks.

These are some quick ideas 

resolve tree:
T1: fleet footwork (reduced effectiveness for ranged), guardian, aftershock (with less free defenses but lower cd and slightly longer time for the damage to come out)
T2: demolish, font of life, **fortification**
T3: mirror shell, iron skin, ablative shield (grants a flat health shield whenever you visit the fountain)
T4: revitalize, second wind

fortification: nearby towers gain armor/mr per nearby allied champion and a regenerating shield. once the shield is depleted it cannot be regenerated until 60 seconds after the tower takes no damage from enemy champions. 

fleet footwork is for some sustain and positioning, guardian is for team shields, aftershock is for adding some damage to your kit when you cc enemies

adamancy tree: 
T1:  (the old) Courage of the Colossus, Grasp of the Undying (no health stacking and more heals but less damage), **Babel Rush**

Babel Rush (phase rush replacement) hitting an opponent with hard crowd control grants 35% movespeed, 10% tenacity, and 75% slow resistance for 2 seconds. effect is lengthened by 0.5 seconds for every instance of damage you deal up to a maximum 4 seconds. 10 second cooldown. Ranged champions do not receive the slow resistance. Melee champions ignore unit collision for the duration.

-old courage is for surviving a big engage, grasp is for sustaining like a boss, Babel Rush is for maneuverability while inside a fight

the rest of the adamancy tree:

reinforced armor (-10% critical strike damage), -4% aoe damage (mastery from 2014), legendary guardian (3 armor/mr per enemy champion that's nearby),
overgrowth, adaptive armor (4% bonus to armor or mr- whichever is lower), perseverance (gain stacking tenacity based on how many times you've been hit by crowd control within the last x seconds)
conditioning (bonus armor/mr after 10 minutes), flat 2 damage reduction from auto attacks and melees get 1/2/3 flat reduction from all damage sources based on level), oppression (-2% damage from enemies who are crowd controlled. doubles to -4% from enemies you cc)

add some extra stuff in there and tweak some junk around an you got a whole new tree. you just need to replace phase rush and fleet footwork tho. just bring back fervor for the precision tree and think of something for battle mages to put in sorcery

I really hate the ones that give you Mr or armor when healing. I mostly play blind picks so for me it is ALWAYS more reliable to take the one that gives you both by the ten minute mark.

I feel like the mr when healing one is crap because if you want to play defensive against mr that is going to be mid lane as a mage yourself, so inspiration for the extra pots and/or watch will always be more efficient since in sorcery you have the mini hexdrinker.

the armor when healing one I only ever find usefull when using a self healing champ like rek sai to have healthier clears early on. Of course this one can be good if you know before hand you are going against a juggernaut or AD bully top lane, but the use cases are too niche (again ADCs and Mages will opt into other diffenses like life steal or watch/extra pots)

I think the resolve tree has to be reorganized for it to feel good. Some runes work great but others feel either to niche or get outmatched by other runes

EDIT: Also many of the resolve runes have to much hidden/unnoticeable power and could benefit from vfx

Honestly the fact that taking resolve basically makes you loose a bunch of offensive power at the start of the game MAY be enough to discourage the use of the tree on damage carries.. I used to run revitalize and either iron skin or magic mirror on Ori and Lux mid to enhance their shields and have a bit more defenses but the AP loss means if I currently go that route I' m getting pushed in at the very start in many matchups so now I have to think way more carefully about what I want as secondary. This aspect still stands even if better defensive runes gets added..

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a8r2Eeey,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-01-19T02:33:17.325+0000)
>
> There's a lot of exploration going on to make the resolve tree feel like it's got a lot more contextual/interesting choices that you can make. It can be pretty tricky balancing defensive runes lest they become "must haves" on everyone, but there's some pretty fun stuff we're playing around with atm. Currently they definitely don't feel particularly exciting when compared to runes in the other trees - we're on it!

This is the sort of response we need more of. Communication goes a long way even if there's nothing in development.

Its good to know the tree is being worked on.

I don't think that the entire resolve tree sucks, I think that Mirror Shell and Iron Skin suck.  Conditioning is just flat better 90% of the time.  Conditioning gives base MR and Armor, neither of the others give base stats, and conditioning gives boosts to BOTH permanently after 10 minutes.  

I get the idea of the distinction that conditioning is supposed to obviously be better later if you can make it through the early game, it just feels like there's way too many restrictions on the other 2 skills.  They give NO base stats, so that doesn't help early, and their % boost is only active while you are healing in some way.  It's not the HARDEST criteria to meet to activate, but it's still... Very comparitively restrictive for how comparitively weak it is.

I honestly don't think it would be overpowered at all to put mirror shell and Iron skin on the same skill and add an entirely new option on that tier... Maybe something that gives you the best of both worlds: active from the 0 minute mark AND always on, but make it, like celestial body, cost you 10% of your damage output to champions... All game though
Is it possible to make more keystones as season goes on?

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a8r2Eeey,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-01-19T02:33:17.325+0000)
>
> There's a lot of exploration going on to make the resolve tree feel like it's got a lot more contextual/interesting choices that you can make. It can be pretty tricky balancing defensive runes lest they become "must haves" on everyone, but there's some pretty fun stuff we're playing around with atm. Currently they definitely don't feel particularly exciting when compared to runes in the other trees - we're on it!

lets face u always undertune tank tree to keep it from being too strong on bruisers. anytime late game scaling tanks become strong you cave and nerf

You could give the Resolve Tree the added stat bonus of a little bonus percentage damage against objectives to make the Tree a better pick (even splashed, I mean) (coupled with those buffs to Towers' tankiness you have planned).

Resolve tree is actually pretty good. Minor rune wise, it's on par with precision and sorcery because of how much flexibility you have, so it's not like those are worse than the others

The keystones are relatively lackluster for solo laners right now (except aftershock), but Aftershock is probably gonna be abused next patch and RIot has been working on a 4th keystone for sometime now.

So what are the bad runes in resolve?
I legit don't see any.

Tanks take sorcery to abuse it, but it doesn't make them tankier. Generally, for the ones that take sorc, it allows them to cheese through lanes through spamming.

Resolve promotes more commitment to fights; that's the complete opposite of the current general meta tank playstyle of whittling away at the opponent.
Jg tanks take resolve and are supposed to naturally have weaker early clears.

Tank junglers aren't really bad, they're just bland and linear, but that has been a problem that's persisted long before runes were introduced.

Resolve isn't bad, though.
funny you mention aftershock being the only decent keystone, because it's already taking hits on the PBE right now as we speak.

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a8r2Eeey,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2018-01-19T09:50:27.857+0000)
>
> funny you mention aftershock being the only decent keystone, because it's already taking hits on the PBE right now as we speak.

The problem with the hits is that it's actually a buff to early game (not dmg, but tankiness). Tanks everywhere taking aftershock will have better laning phases (they don't take it regardless though). Tank jglers will have better early ganks/diving, making them better suited for the current meta. I don't think the tank jglers need that, but fair enough.

The problematic part is when non-tank champions take the keystone, and just win trades because of it, just like the old aftershock. Darius, for instance. For those champs, the new flat 100 armor/MR, is, for most of the game, better than the original 30+% scaling.
Only compared to previous PBE versions - it is still massively buffed compared to live, unless you normally built over 330 Armor and MR.

Amm after shock is one of the best keystones for those who can utilize it.
Besides that all the choices are solid picks none of them seem weak, i like them.

The only gripe i have is the line where you chooese 5 MR/armor or 8 MR+Armor after 10 minutes.. those are kinda crappy.

my point is exactly that. 

that there realy is no mastery that helps tank junglers early game.

+10/10 whatever it's called is great, but it only works 10 minutes into the game by which time the whole 5 min of early gank phase is over. and unless you got lucky, if u were agaisnts a good player, he will have ravaged your lanes

> [{quoted}](name=JackMcSnipeyz,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a8r2Eeey,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-19T01:58:37.809+0000)
>
> for those who can utilize it.

it's a shit early game mastery that offers nothing to tank junglers. 

yeah it;s good late game on tanks.

fucking useless on early game for tanks and this game is all about early game now
Idk, supports running it do impactful amount of damage in early fights.

u trolling ? this thread is about masteries offering nothing to tank junglers.

nothing about supports

Why did you replay to me 3 times?
Your title clearly stated "resolve tree sucks", im showing you how it doesnt suck, and has it's uses.
Just because it doesnt fit your cookie cutter 3 champs you keep spamming doesnt mean it's a bad tree.

what did you show me ? explain again.. im so stupid i must have missed your point. Please reiterate.

let me remind you this thread is about how TANK JUNGLERS get really not much of anything out of the runes unless they can abuse a mastery (e.g. {{champion:102}}  with press the attack)

not about support nor any other role.

TANK JUNGLE...that can't even get flat AD or Flat armor out of the runes...oh unless they invest in the garbage Resolve tree for a measly couple armor which is lower than the old runes provided

So are you complaining about tanks not having masterirs? Or the resolve tree sucking? Or that the only the resolve tree benefits tank junglers?

Your posts are all over te place, which is understand able seeing as you replied to me 3 tines over 1 post.

I have three things to say that will contradict your entire point.

1. AfterShock
2. Demolish
3.Overgrowth
4: Grasp of the Undying
I agree that resolve is strong as any tree, overgrowth in pariticular is pretty bad.
im a little bias on that one because i love it on sion to have a free 1k hp for just farming it's alot of fun but ya its not that good
Resolve is strong af what are you talking about

Outside of the keystones it's unarguably the weakest tree. The base runes in this tree are heavily outclassed by every other tree in the game and the stat it gives is the most undesirable of any tree, even with the 50/50 split that was introduced very few champions actually want early game HP and even most tanks would prefer AS/AD/AP.

If you want to understand how bad Resolve is outside of keystones go and look up how many champs actually run Resolve secondary. Even champs who logically should, namely Bruisers avoid Resolve secondary like the plague. Taking Resolve means trading 9% AS or 5.4/6 AD for 65 HP which are terrible tradeoffs. That's before mentioning that the runes in Resolve are just sub-par.

Resolve as a tree is entirely held up by two absurd Keystones, other than that the tree is pretty pathetic.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a8r2Eeey,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-01-19T04:27:53.069+0000)
>
> Outside of the keystones it's unarguably the weakest tree. The base runes in this tree are heavily outclassed by every other tree in the game and the stat it gives is the most undesirable of any tree, even with the 50/50 split that was introduced very few champions actually want early game HP and even most tanks would prefer AS/AD/AP.
> 
> If you want to understand how bad Resolve is outside of keystones go and look up how many champs actually run Resolve secondary. Even champs who logically should, namely Bruisers avoid Resolve secondary like the plague. Taking Resolve means trading 9% AS or 5.4/6 AD for 65 HP which are terrible tradeoffs. That's before mentioning that the runes in Resolve are just sub-par.
> 
> Resolve as a tree is entirely held up by two absurd Keystones, other than that the tree is pretty pathetic.

PRetty much this. I've been slowly wittling away my use of resolve even as a {{champion:78}} because the stats and benefits from it are fucking negligable. Conditioning is not a viable replacement for siegemaster, legendary guardian, fearless, and the armor reds and quints from the old system, and the other options in its slot are hot garbage entirely. 

Nothing else in the tree is even worth mentioning. The slot with demooish offers no survivabiilty whatsoever in any of its options, and the final slot is  % health buff that never will be enough in a game to be worth taking, an extra 40 or so health from heals which mean nothing in fights, and a passive "health regenerating" rune which heals less than a single fight using  Ravenous Hunter would over the length of the entire game. 

Meanwhile taking sorcery + domination, I get about 100 gold more worth of stats straight out of the gate, arcane comet making trades actually possible, null orb acting as a better MR buff than anything in resolve can, transcendence letting me build full tank and actually have damage scaling,  and a final slot with two extremely good options and one niche one in the form of gathering storm for expected long games. In Domination, taste of blood improves trades and provides better sustain than the entire resolve path on its own,  and ravenous hunter makes prolonged fights actually possible. And that's without even going into the other options in the trees, all of which are better than anything resolve offers.

Even among the keystone, the only one worth taking a second glance at is Aftershock because of how ridiculously overtuned it is, and it's still worse than Courage of the Colossus was in that it merely prevents some damage through extra resistances instead of potentially all damage with a straight up shield. Grasp is completely unusable with how poke, burst, and trade heavy laning top is now, even with it being stronger than its mastery version in a vacuum. 

The new runes are supposed to be stronger than the old masteries, but Resolve's are just straight booty.
I just don't understand why Grasp of the Undying has a higher damage ratio than it's healing ratio. I thought it's supposed to be a defensive rune, not a damage steroid for tanks.

Grasp of the Undying is not supposed to be defensive by nature.
It pretty much is designed as **the** to go keystone for Juggernauts, champions who are building alot of health and want to deal significant damage in extended trades.

Grasp provides exactly that. It gives them sustain + extra health in lane and uses your big health pool to deal significant damage over time.
and then you realize that some of the tank junglers are one of the most broken champions currently... but that's ok

Aftershock and Demolish are decent I find, especially on tanks, while all the others are sub-par. If you're not playing a melee that can effectively make use of Aftershock, the other trees would net better results.
